p: Similarly, elvitegravir drug selections performed on four large cluster variants progressed more rapidly, leading to the first acquisition of the INSTI resistance mutations T66I ( n = 2), N155H ( n = 1) or S147G ( n = 1) at week 8, followed by the further accumulation of resistance mutations leading to viral escape (>100-fold resistance) at weeks 23 and 36 (Figure 3b). In contrast, elvitegravir selections performed on singleton/small cluster viral lineages were delayed with the first appearance of T66I as a singlet mutation occurring at week 23 in only two of four small cluster strains (Figure 4b).
